data.quote: A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.
data.author: Walter Winchell

data.quote: If you live to be 100, I hope I live to be 100 minus 1 day, so I never have to live without you.
data.author: Winnie the Pooh

data.quote: I like to listen. I have learned a great deal from listening carefully. Most people never listen.
data.author: Ernest Hemingway

data.quote: Friendship is born at that moment when one person says to another, ‘What! You too? I thought I was the only one.
data.author: C.S. Lewis

data.quote: True friendship comes when the silence between two people is comfortable.
data.author: David Tyson

data.quote: Sweet is the memory of distant friends! Like the mellow rays of the departing sun, it falls tenderly, yet sadly, on the heart.
data.author: Washington Irving

data.quote: There’s not a word yet for old friends who’ve just met.
data.author: Jim Henson

data.quote: You can make more friends in two months by becoming interested in other people than you can in two years by trying to get other people interested in you.
data.author: Dale Carnegie

data.quote: Ultimately the bond of all companionship, whether in marriage or in friendship, is conversation.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: How many slams in an old screen door? Depends how loud you shut it. How many slices in a bread? Depends how thin you cut it. How much good inside a day? Depends how good you live ’em. How much love inside a friend? Depends how much you give ’em.
data.author: Shel Silverstein
